summary.p: #38. a) PIM, main shrine; b) on the upper part of the base (pattika) of the central wall section of the ardha-maṇḍapa of the southern façade; c) personally located and read in situ; d) ARE 1924, no. 397; SII 19, no. 140; Tyagarajan (2014: no. 2, 117–118); e) 5th regnal year of Kōpparakesarivarman; f) Cōḻa king difficult to identify; g) inscription not read with anyone; h) the puḷḷi appears on some of the letters only; I have spotted the beginning of an inscription (just svasti śrī) on the eastern part of the ardha-maṇḍapa, on the same upper part of the base.

Fortune! Prosperity! This is the fifth year of Kōpparakesarivarman. For Mahādeva (mahadevakkku > mahādevarkku) of the shrine (girahattu > gṛhattu) of the Lord (īśva > īśvara) [of] Pakaiviṭai [lit. a bull/distress viṭai for his enemies pakai] of Maṉṉupperumpaḻuvūr [lit. the exceedingly maṉṉum big perum Paḻuvūr)] of Kuṉṟakkūṟṟam, the dancing child kūtta-piḷḷai of this temple (itaḷi > ittaḷi) Nakkaṉ Kiṭaṉtaperumāṉ placed vaitta ten 10 [kaḻañcus] of gold poṉ with one oṉṟunāl lamp viḷakku.
